title: John Buchan Way Walking Route

images.title: Eileen Henderson / Footbridge over the Hollows Burn
images.caption: Footbridge over the Hollows Burn. This is a fairly new bridge on the John Buchan Way, a footpath running between Broughton and Peebles. It crosses the Hollows Burn just beside the ford indicated on the OS 1:50,000 map.

images.title: Eileen Henderson / Path through the hills
images.caption: Path through the hills. The wooden post indicates the route of the John Buchan Way, seen here heading to the east between Broomy Side, rising on the left of the photo, and round the northern side of Hammer Head, seen on the right. In the distance is the peak of Penvalla (537m).

images.caption: Gate and stile

images.caption: Bellanrigg. Viewed from the trail as it traverses Cademuir Hill.

images.title: Jim Barton / River Tweed bridge at Stobo
images.caption: River Tweed bridge at Stobo. Where the trail crosses the Tweed. The route next meets the river at Peebles.

images.title: Eileen Henderson / Track through the hills
images.caption: This old track between Stobo and Broughton has become part of the trail. This view looks north-westwards towards Stobo Hopehead, with the peak of Green Law (565m) on the left.

description: A walk through the Scottish borders named after John Buchan, the author of The Thirty-Nine Steps, who lived in the area. The walk runs from Broughton to Peebles and passes the Broughton Hills, Stobo Castle, The Glack and Cademuir Hill. There are also regular views of the River Tweed to enjoy on this beautiful walk. The route is waymarked with a JBW logo.
